channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Ditty
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Ditty

item.title: CVE-2023-4148|2024-08-02T07:17:12.133Z -- unknown -- ditty
item.description: The Ditty WordPress plugin before 3.1.25 does not sanitise and escape some parameters and generated URLs before outputting them back in attributes, leading to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin.

item.title: CVE-2024-5575|2024-08-01T21:18:06.451Z -- unknown -- ditty
item.description: The Ditty WordPress plugin before 3.1.43 does not sanitise and escape some of its blocks' settings, which could allow high privilege users such as authors to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when unfiltered_html is disallowed

item.title: CVE-2024-5575|2024-07-15T13:50:55.441Z -- unknown -- ditty
item.description: The Ditty WordPress plugin before 3.1.43 does not sanitise and escape some of its blocks' settings, which could allow high privilege users such as authors to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when unfiltered_html is disallowed

item.title: CVE-2024-3939|2024-06-06T18:27:04.548Z -- unknown -- ditty
item.description: The Ditty WordPress plugin before 3.1.36 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-5575|2024-07-13T06:00:12.200Z -- unknown -- ditty
item.description: The Ditty WordPress plugin before 3.1.43 does not sanitise and escape some of its blocks' settings, which could allow high privilege users such as authors to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when unfiltered_html is disallowed

item.title: CVE-2024-3939|2024-08-01T20:26:57.093Z -- unknown -- ditty
item.description: The Ditty WordPress plugin before 3.1.36 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)
